title: Senior Media Finance Manager
description:
**About us:**  
Much of what you need to know about minds + assembly is captured in the name itself: we think we create and (+) we put things together. It’s really that simple—and that shockingly different. Of course, the simplicity of our name belies the depth of what we deliver to our most honored (and often overjoyed) clients. Our work is consistently at a higher caliber than they are used to, simply because we push ourselves to think and build differently. Combine this with an obsessive attention to client service, and you arrive at a place where we stand alone among agencies. Arrogant? No. Confident? Of course, but only because we’ve put together a team of people who are good AF in every way.  
  
At minds + assembly, the engine of our business is commercial invention. We approach every project—actually, every aspect of our work—as an opportunity to dip our toes into the revitalizing stream of the new. The original conception of our agency (which has since been realized) was that of a happy workshop, a place where the mind and hands are free to construct brilliant new things for our clients. Yet, we never forget that we are in fact a business. Everything we do is to further the commercial goals of our clients, whether that is to sell a product or an idea. To achieve this, we continue to add only the best people, those who have the right talent, temperament, and teamwork-orientation to further our collective goals. Then we ask that each person adhere to two simple and equally important principles: uncompromising standards and unconditional support. In other words, we push each other, hard, to produce the best work possible, yet always with the knowledge that we have each other’s backs.  
  
**Role Overview:**  
The Senior Media Finance Manager plays a critical role in bridging media investment operations and financial governance within the agency. This individual will be responsible for helping to set up and manage workflows within Prisma, the agency’s media buying and billing platform, and will partner closely with media, finance, and operations teams to ensure accurate, efficient, and compliant financial management of all media spend.  
  
This role requires a blend of financial acumen, media workflow knowledge, and platform proficiency, with a strong focus on maintaining budget accuracy, and supporting cross-functional teams from planning and buying through to reconciliation and invoicing. The Senior Media Finance Manager will ensure standardized, accurate and timely management of working media expenses through the Prisma platform.
  
  
**Key Responsibilities:**  
  
Prisma Setup & Management

* Play a key role in the set-up and governance of Prisma
* Partner with media teams to ensure accurate budget allocations, and vendor details in Prisma.
* Implement and enforce consistent workflows for purchase order creation, authorizations, and reconciliations.
* Serve as the platform expert and point of contact for any Prisma-related training, troubleshooting, and updates.
* Collaborate with IT, finance, and media operations teams to ensure system integrations and data syncs are functioning properly (e.g., with billing, ERP, or analytics tools).

  
Media Budget Oversight & Reconciliation

* Monitor and maintain accurate tracking of all paid media spend across campaigns, channels, and vendors.
* Lead monthly and quarterly media financial close processes, including actuals vs. planned reporting, accruals, and variance analysis.
* Partner with media planning team to proactively flag budget discrepancies or pacing issues.
* Ensure all billing aligns with contracted rates, scopes of work, and client requirements.

  
Vendor & Partner Coordination

* Liaise with media vendors, publishers, and third-party platforms to ensure timely receipt of invoices and resolution of billing discrepancies.
* Support audits and compliance reviews as needed, ensuring clean financial records and platform data.

  
Experience:

* 3+ years of experience in media finance, preferably within an advertising agency or media company.
* Strong understanding of media buying and planning processes (TV, digital, print, etc.).
* Advanced Excel skills and experience with financial software (e.g., SAP, Oracle, or media systems like Prisma, MediaOcean, Advantage).
* Exceptional attention to detail, organizational, and analytical skills.
* Ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment with shifting priorities.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.

  

B9X8uUtHbe

title: Senior Manager, Retail Media Activation O+O
description:
**Job Title:** Sr. Manager, Retail Media Activation O+O (CDMO)
  
  
**Division:** CDMO
  
  
**Location:** Hudson Yards, New York City
  
  
**Reports to:** Director - Retail Media
  
  
**Who We Are:**  
For more than a century, L’Oréal has devoted its energy, innovation, and scientific excellence solely to one business: Beauty. Our goal is to offer each and every person around the world the best of beauty in terms of quality, efficacy, safety, sincerity and responsibility to satisfy all beauty needs and desires in their infinite diversity.
  
  
At L’Oréal, our Digital team is an opportunity to be at the center of L'Oréal's digital transformation. We are determined to be pioneers in the new beauty tech world, and by incorporating digital into everything that we do, we are creating a better relationship with our consumers. When beauty and tech collide, the impossible can happen! Come join our dynamic team!
  
  
**What you will do:**  
The Retail Media O+O Sr. Manager is responsible for the planning, execution, and performance of Self-Service media activations that deliver on business sales plans and brand goals. This role owns the media activation and execution through a hands-on-keyboard model: overseeing self-service programmatic display and executing self-service search. Additionally, this role is responsible for the integration and acceleration of retail media networks into a holistic omni plan that drives a seamless journey. This role requires a deep understanding of retail media platforms, strong analytical skills, and a proven ability to drive business growth through effective media strategies.
  
  

* Create a full funnel strategy in partnership with key brand stakeholders to ensure consumers are reached at all points in their shopping journey. (Creating a collaborative Search and Display strategy)
* Hands-on-keyboard execution, optimization, reporting and overall management of key retail Search platforms (i.e. Criteo, Roundel Media Studio, and Walmart)
* Manage Retail Media Budgets, monthly phasing and reconciliation across Retail Media accounts including Walmart, Target, Club, Grocery, and other Key Accounts
* Contribute to the creation and optimization of media strategies, including of the development of strategic roadmaps, test plans, results and risk/benefit analysis, as well as performance reports with actionable insights
* Develop data-driven, retailer specific media plans per brand and business goals, including budget planning, activation and reporting of retailer display campaigns
* Audit ad tech and capabilities across all media platforms to remain abreast on technical skillsets, new retailer led media opportunities, and optimal spend structure and strategy
* Analyze and report on monthly, quarterly and annual ad spend with competitive views and liaise with broader Media teams, Data Science, and Sales teams to understand full effects of campaigns
* Serve as a point-of-contact for internal and external account partnerships; manage relationships with all retailer media partners/platforms
* Share and present media strategy, performance updates, learning agendas, best practices and on-brand opportunities with cross-functional partners & key stakeholders regularly

**What We Are Looking For:**  
This high-impact role is best-suited for a technical, tactical media strategist who is also a team player, with strong people skills, interest to create and collaborate on business-accelerating full funnel frameworks.
  
  

* 6 years of agency or CPG experience, including media planning/buying agency partners, ideally with hands-on-keyboard experience
* Digital media planning and buying (both Search and Display), with proven ability to deliver consistently strong, measurable results via data-driven marketing
* Deep knowledge of current best practices and new strategies for retailer digital media platforms, Criteo, Walmart Connect and Roundel is ideal
* Expert in end-to-end campaign development, execution, optimization and measurement; deep understanding in funnel metrics, pipeline building, lead lifecycle and nurturing
* Experience analyzing performance data and summarizing / communicating findings via reports and high-impact presentations
* Proven success in developing full-funnel on-site retailer media plans, clearly defined KPIs/metrics, reporting with detailed written narrative
* Deep knowledge of audience segmentation, custom report configuration, attribution, cross-device, multi-channel tracking, media math and metric relationships for swift data-driven optimization
* Demonstrated strong analytical ability, understanding of A/B testing methodologies, with the ability to draw conclusions from data and act accordingly

As an integral part of our culture at L’Oréal, wellness is at our core. We not only offer a generous Benefits Package (Medical, Dental, Vision, 401K), we also offer flexible time off, work from home days, and a pension plan! Additionally, you will have access to company perks such as Makeup, Skincare, and Fragrance! Employees receive a stipend for L'Oréal products as well as VIP Access to L’Oréal’s Internal Shop for Discounted Products, and other perks such as Monthly Mobile Allowance, discounted gym memberships, and ERGs.
  
  
**Additional Benefits Information As Follows:**  

* Salary Range: $117,400-$167,300 (The actual compensation will depend on a variety of job-related factors which may include geographic location, work experience, education, and skill level)
* Competitive Benefit Package (Medical, Dental, Vision, 401K, Pension Plan)
* Hybrid Work Policy (3 Days in Office, 2 Days Work from Home)
* Flexible Time Off (Paid Company Holidays, Paid Vacation, Vacation Buy Program, Volunteer Time, Summer Fridays & More!)
* Access to Company Perks (VIP Access to L’Oréal’s Internal Shop for Discounted Products, Monthly Mobile Allowance)
* Learning & Development Opportunities (Unlimited Access to E-learnings, Lunch & Learn Sessions, Mentorship Programs, & More!)
* Employee Resource Groups (Think Tanks and Innovation Squads)
* Access to Mental Health & Wellness Programs

Don’t meet every single requirement? At L'Oréal, we are dedicated to building a diverse, inclusive, and innovative workplace. If you’re excited about this role but your past experience doesn’t align perfectly with the qualifications listed in the job description, we encourage you to apply anyways! You may just be the right candidate for this or other roles!
  
  
We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and take pride in a diverse environment. We would love to find out more about you as a candidate and do not discriminate in recruitment, hiring, training, promotion, or other employment practices for reasons of race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, age, marital or veteran status, medical condition or disability, or any other legally protected status.
  
  
If you are a qualified individual with a disability or a disabled veteran, you may request a reasonable accommodation if you are unable or limited in your ability to access job openings or apply for a job on this site as a result of your disability. You can request reasonable accommodations by contacting [1] USApplicationAccommodation@support.lorealusa.com. If you need assistance to accommodate a disability, you may request an accommodation at any time.
  
  
**Our Safe Together Plan:** Your safety is our highest priority. We will proceed with caution and adhere to enhanced protection standards to ensure our sites are safe for all employees. We must all operate with the shared responsibility for each other’s health & safety in mind.
  
References
